suncertify.network
Class DataRemote

java.lang.Object
  java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
          java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
              suncertify.network.DataRemote
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, DBRemote
public class DataRemote
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements DBRemote

This class represents the RMI implementation of the DBRemote interface. An object of this class contains a reference to the database.

This class acts as an adapter or wrapper of the remote database.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Pedro Oliveira
See Also:
DBRemote, UnicastRemoteObject, Serialized Form

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if an a remote access to database could not be obtained.

read

public java.lang.String[] read(int recNo)
                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                               RecordNotFoundException
Description copied from interface: DBRemote
Reads a record from the file. Returns an array where each element is a record value.

Specified by:
read in interface DBRemote
Parameters:
recNo - the record number to retrieve from the database.
Returns:
a String array containing all of the elements for the given recNo
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if an exception is thrown due to remote errors.
RecordNotFoundException - if the specified record number does not exist in the database.

update

public void update(int recNo,
                   java.lang.String[] data,
                   long lockCookie)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                   RecordNotFoundException,
                   java.lang.SecurityException
Description copied from interface: DBRemote
Modifies the fields of a record. The new value for field n appears in data[n].

Specified by:
update in interface DBRemote
Parameters:
recNo - the record number to update in the database.
data - a String array with the new data of the given record.
lockCookie - cookie value trying to get access to the record.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if an exception is thrown due to remote errors.
RecordNotFoundException - if the specified record number does not exist in the database.
java.lang.SecurityException - if lockCookie is not the cookie value that holds the lock for the given record number.

find

public int[] find(java.lang.String[] criteria)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Description copied from interface: DBRemote
Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria. Field n in the database file is described by criteria[n].

A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy".)

Specified by:
find in interface DBRemote
Parameters:
criteria - a array of strings with the patterns that must be matched in the search performed.
Returns:
an array of integers with the record numbers that match the specified criteria.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if an exception is thrown due to remote errors.

create

public int create(java.lang.String[] data)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                  DuplicateKeyException
Description copied from interface: DBRemote
Creates a new record in the database (reusing a deleted entry if one exists). Inserts the given data, and returns the record number of the new record.

Specified by:
create in interface DBRemote
Parameters:
data - a String array with the data to set for the new record.
Returns:
the record number of the newly created record.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if an exception is thrown due to remote errors.
DuplicateKeyException - if the data given violates the primary key constraint of the database.

lock

public long lock(int recNo)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                 RecordNotFoundException
Description copied from interface: DBRemote
Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client. Returned value is a cookie that must be used when the record is unlocked, updated, or deleted. If the specified record is already locked by a different client, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked.

Specified by:
lock in interface DBRemote
Parameters:
recNo - the record number to lock in the database.
Returns:
the cookie value generated by the locking mechanism.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if an exception is thrown due to remote errors.
RecordNotFoundException - if the specified record number does not exist in the database.

unlock

public void unlock(int recNo,
                   long cookie)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                   RecordNotFoundException,
                   java.lang.SecurityException
Description copied from interface: DBRemote
Releases the lock on a record. Cookie must be the cookie returned when the record was locked; otherwise throws SecurityException.

Specified by:
unlock in interface DBRemote
Parameters:
recNo - the record number to unlock in the database.
cookie - cookie value trying to get access to the record.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if an exception is thrown due to remote errors.
RecordNotFoundException - if the specified record number does not exist in the database.
java.lang.SecurityException - if lockCookie is not the cookie value that holds the lock for the given record number.
